item.title: UNIX Commands and Tips
item.description: Basic UNIX Commands General syntax of a UNIX command: Note: Options may also be called switches or flags, and an argument is also called a parameter. Navigation pwd - Print working directory (pwd or cwd). Tells you were you are, in what folder. Note that while in Windows the root directory is “C:", in UNIX the root directory is designated by “/”, which elsewhere is just used as a separator inside a path.
